newsitem.title: USA: Seagram sells nearly half of its Time Warner stake.
newsitem.headline: Seagram sells nearly half of its Time Warner stake.

text.p: Canadian beverage and entertainment giant Seagram Co. Ltd. Wednesday sold nearly half of its stake in Time Warner Inc. for $1.39 billion in cash.

In a statement, Montreal-based Seagram said it sold 30 million shares to Merrill Lynch & Co. and continues to hold approximately 26.8 million Time Warner shares. The company said it agreed not to sell the additional shares for a period of 120 days without Merrill Lynch & Co.'s consent.

Seagram said net proceeds after tax will be approximately $1.33 billion and will be used for general corporate purposes, including repayment of debt and share repurchases under Seagram's share purchase programme.

Separately, the company said its board of directors authorised an increase in the size of its share purchase programme to 10 percent of the public float, up to approximately 23.6 million common shares, subject to appropriate regulatory filings.

"As we have said before, since our acquisition of Universal Studios Inc. in June 1995, our position in Time Warner has been non-strategic," Seagram President and Chief Executive Officer Edgar Bronfman Jr. said in a statement. "Given the recent price improvement in Time Warner stock, we believe this was an appropriate time to reduce the size of our holdings. We remain a significant shareholder and see prospects for further appreciation in the price of Time Warner stock."
A Time Warner spokesman said the company was not surprised by the decision and it is sure Time Warner's new shareholders will "enjoy appreciation in our stock over time."
